content.description: I was quite stoked with how this one climbed, fun and bouldery. Begin with a powerful boulder problem right off the deck, ending at a jug. Clip a bolt, then move up and left to clip the 3rd bolt on Gnar Trek. Climb up and right following the seam, avoiding the arete, and clip the steel draw at the jug rail. Pull the last couple moves to clip the top chains.
content.protection: 5 bolts to chains. Stick clip the second bolt. The first bolt redirects the rope out of the way for the boulder problem start, and can also be used for a semi-hanging belay.
content.location: Start on the ledge a few feet to the right of Gnar Trek. Look for a left hand sidepull and a tiny right hand crimp to start.

content.description: The direct finish to Gnarth Brooks. Add a couple moves from the jug rail to reach the anchors at the top. Best 12 in BCC according to Dono!
content.location: Far right of the Gnar Wall.

content.description: Starts in a little corner on the right, some bigger moves lead to the final long jug rail. Follow this to the far left, and lower off the last fixed draw.
content.location: Far right line on the Gnar Wall.

climbs.name: Gnarlottes Web
climbs.fa: Donovan Allen and Dan Soria. FA on gear Dylan Pike

content.description:
(AKA Dan's Dihedral)

30m of climbing up a cool looking dihedral.

Start with a little boulder problem involving a heel hook and a mono, followed by mid 12 climbing to the top. Alternatively, there is cool dyno beta to skip the mono. End at the anchors shared by Gnarth Brooks direct.
Climb Gnarth Brooks to the end of the rail, clip the cable draw, then downclimb Gnar Trek to the ground!
content.location: Start on the far right bolt line.

content.description: Climb up the left side and arete to the top anchors.
content.location: Far left line on the Gnar Wall

content.description: Linkup from Gnarth Brooks into Gnarkness at the 5th bolts (there is a new link-up bolt sans draw). Finish at the top anchors.
content.protection: Bolts,(new link-up bolt added)Â no longer run out to link the two, but you go from a jug to an incut pocket, to the jug block on gnarkness before you clip, so its not too bad. Would maybe recommend bringing a sling for the bolt on gnarkness, as this would keep the rope out of the way better.

content.description: Sandbagged warm up, every area's gotta have one!
content.location: Above the Gnar Wall proper on a more vertical wall, faces down the gully
